025package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.hsluv;
026
027import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
028import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
029import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
030import com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.FloatColors;
031import com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.TrigTools;
032
033import java.util.Random;
034
035/**
036 * Contains code for manipulating colors as {@code int} and packed {@code float} values in the HSLuv color space.
037 * See <a href="https://www.hsluv.org/">HSLuv's website</a> for more info.
038 * <br>
039 * The HSLuv color space has 3 channels, Hue, Saturation, and Lightness. Lightness should be much more even when hue and
040 * saturation change, when compared with "vanilla" HSL or HSV. This also has an alpha channel in each color,
041 * which acts like it does in every other color space package here (multiplicative alpha, higher is more opaque).
042 */
043public class ColorTools {
044    /**
045     * No need to instantiate.
046     */
047    private ColorTools(){
048    }
049    /**
050     * Gets a packed float representation of a color given as 4 float components, here, hue, saturation, lightness, and
051     * alpha (or opacity). As long as you use a batch with {@code Shaders#fragmentShaderHsluv} as its shader, colors
052     * passed with {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch#setPackedColor(float)} will be interpreted as HSLuv. H
053     * should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0.0f or so meaning reddish, 0.3f or so meaning greenish, and 0.7 or so
054     * meaning bluish. S should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0 meaning grayscale and 1 meaning fully bold/bright.
055     * L should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0 used for very dark colors (almost only black), and 1 used for very
056     * light colors (almost only white). Alpha is the multiplicative opacity of the color, and acts like RGBA's alpha.
057     *
058     * @param h     0f to 1f, hue component, with 0.0f meaning red, 0.3 meaning green, and 0.7 meaning blue
059     * @param s     0f to 1f, saturation component, with 0.0f meaning grayscale and 1.0f meaning fully bold/bright
060     * @param l     0f to 1f, lightness component, with 0.5f meaning "no change" and 1f brightening
061     * @param alpha 0f to 1f, 0f makes the color transparent and 1f makes it opaque
062     * @return a float encoding a color with the given properties
063     */
064    public static float hsluv(float h, float s, float l, float alpha) {
065        return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(((int) (alpha * 255.999f) << 24 & 0xFE000000) | ((int) (l * 255.999f) << 16 & 0xFF0000)
066                | ((int) (s * 255.999f) << 8 & 0xFF00) | ((int) (h * 255.999f) & 0xFF));
067    }
068    /**
069     * Gets a packed float representation of a color given as 4 float components, H, S, L, and alpha, with the S, L, and
070     * alpha components clamped to the 0f to 1f range before being entered into the packed float color, while H is
071     * wrapped into the same range. This is only different from {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)} in that it
072     * clamps or wraps each component.
073     *
074     * @see #hsluv(float, float, float, float) This uses the same definitions for H, S, L, and alpha as hsluv().
075     * @param h     0f to 1f, hue component, with 0.0f meaning red, 0.3 meaning green, and 0.7 meaning blue
076     * @param s     0f to 1f, saturation component, with 0.0f meaning grayscale and 1.0f meaning fully bold/bright
077     * @param l     0f to 1f, lightness component, with 0.5f meaning "no change" and 1f brightening
078     * @param alpha 0f to 1f, 0f makes the color transparent and 1f makes it opaque
079     * @return a float encoding a color with the given properties
080     */
081    public static float clamp(float h, float s, float l, float alpha) {
082        return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((Math.min(Math.max((int) (alpha * 127.999f), 0), 127) << 25)
083                | (Math.min(Math.max((int) (l * 255.999f), 0), 255) << 16)
084                | (Math.min(Math.max((int) (s * 255.999f), 0), 255) << 8)
085                | (int) ((h - MathUtils.floor(h)) * 256f)
086        );
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * An approximation of the cube-root function for float inputs and outputs.
091     * This can be about twice as fast as {@link Math#cbrt(double)}. This
092     * version does not tolerate negative inputs, because in the narrow use
093     * case it has in this class, it never is given negative inputs.
094     * <br>
095     * Has very low relative error (less than 1E-9) when inputs are uniformly
096     * distributed between 0 and 512, and absolute mean error of less than
097     * 1E-6 in the same scenario. Uses a bit-twiddling method similar to one
098     * presented in Hacker's Delight and also used in early 3D graphics (see
099     * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_inverse_square_root for more, but
100     * this code approximates cbrt(x) and not 1/sqrt(x)). This specific code
101     * was originally by Marc B. Reynolds, posted in his "Stand-alone-junk"
102     * repo: https://github.com/Marc-B-Reynolds/Stand-alone-junk/blob/master/src/Posts/ballcube.c#L182-L197 .
103     * It's worth noting that while hardware instructions for finding the
104     * square root of a float have gotten extremely fast, the same is not
105     * true for the cube root (which has to allow negative inputs), so while
106     * the bit-twiddling inverse square root is no longer a beneficial
107     * optimization on current hardware, this does seem to help.
108     * <br>
109     * This is used when converting from RGB to HSLuv, as an intermediate step.
110     * @param x any non-negative finite float to find the cube root of
111     * @return the cube root of x, approximated
112     */
113    private static float cbrtPositive(float x) {
114        int ix = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(x);
115        final float x0 = x;
116        ix = (ix>>>2) + (ix>>>4);
117        ix += (ix>>>4);
118        ix += (ix>>>8) + 0x2A5137A0;
119        x  = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(ix);
120        x  = 0.33333334f*(2f * x + x0/(x*x));
121        x  = 0.33333334f*(1.9999999f * x + x0/(x*x));
122        return x;
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * Used when given non-linear sRGB inputs to make them linear, using an exact gamma of 2.4 and accounting for the
127     * darkest colors with a different formula. This is rather close to squaring {@code component}.
128     * @param component any non-linear channel of a color, to be made linear
129     * @return a linear version of component
130     */
131    private static float forwardGamma(final float component) {
132        return component < 0.04045f ? component * (1f/12.92f) : (float)Math.pow((component + 0.055f) * (1f/1.055f), 2.4f);
133    }
134
135    /**
136     * Used to return from a linear, gamma-corrected input to an sRGB, non-linear output, using an exact gamma of 2.4
137     * and accounting for the darkest colors with a different formula. This is mostly similar to the square root, but is
138     * more precise for very dark colors.
139     * @param component a linear channel of a color, to be made non-linear
140     * @return a non-linear version of component
141     */
142    private static float reverseGamma(final float component) {
143        return component < 0.0031308f ? component * 12.92f : (float)Math.pow(component, 1f/2.4f) * 1.055f - 0.055f;
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Changes the curve of a requested L value so that it matches the internally-used curve. This takes a curve with a
148     * dark area similar to sRGB (a fairly small one), and makes it significantly larger. This is typically used on
149     * "to HSLuv" conversions. This is much less potent of a change than the method used by Oklab.
150     * @param L lightness, from 0 to 1 inclusive
151     * @return an adjusted L value that can be used internally
152     */
153    public static float forwardLight(final float L) {
154        final float shape = 0.8528f, turning = 0.1f;
155        final float d = turning - L;
156        if(d < 0)
157            return ((1f - turning) * (L - 1f)) / (1f - (L + shape * d)) + 1f;
158        else
159            return (turning * L) / (1e-20f + (L + shape * d));
160    }
161    /**
162     * Changes the curve of the internally-used lightness when it is output to another format. This makes the dark area
163     * area smaller, matching (kind-of) the curve that the standard sRGB lightness uses. This is typically used on "from
164     * HSLuv" conversions. This is much less potent of a change than the method used by Oklab.
165     * @param L lightness, from 0 to 1 inclusive
166     * @return an adjusted L value that can be fed into a conversion to RGBA or something similar
167     */
168    public static float reverseLight(final float L) {
169        final float shape = 1.1726f, turning = 0.1f;
170        final float d = turning - L;
171        if(d < 0)
172            return ((1f - turning) * (L - 1f)) / (1f - (L + shape * d)) + 1f;
173        else
174            return (turning * L) / (1e-20f + (L + shape * d));
175    }
176
177    private static final float[][] m = new float[][] {
178            new float[] {+3.2404542f, -1.5371385f, -0.4985314f},
179            new float[] {-0.9692660f, +1.8760108f, +0.0415560f},
180            new float[] {+0.0556434f, -0.2040259f, +1.0572252f},
181    };
182    private static final float refU = 0.19783000664283f, refV = 0.46831999493879f;
183    private static final float kappa = 9.032962962f, epsilon = 0.0088564516f;
184
185    /**
186     * Converts a packed float color in the format produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)} to an RGBA8888 int.
187     * This format of int can be used with Pixmap and in some other places in libGDX.
188     * @param packed a packed float color, as produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
189     * @return an RGBA8888 int color
190     */
191    public static int toRGBA8888(final float packed)
192    {
193        final int decoded = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
194        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
195        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
196        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
197
198        // HSLuv to Lch
199        float C;
200        if (L > 0.99999f) {
201            L = 1;
202            C = 0;
203        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
204            L = 0;
205            C = 0;
206        } else
207            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
208
209        // Lch to Luv
210        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
211        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
212
213        // Luv to XYZ
214        float x, y, z;
215        if (L < 0.00001f) {
216            return (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
217        } else if(L > 0.9999f) {
218            return 0xFFFFFF00 | (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
219        }else {
220            if (L <= 0.08f)
221                y = L / kappa;
222            else {
223                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
224                y *= y * y;
225            }
226            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
227            float varU = U * iL + refU;
228            float varV = V * iL + refV;
229            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
230            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
231        }
232        final int r = (int)(reverseGamma(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z) * 255.999f);
233        final int g = (int)(reverseGamma(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z) * 255.999f);
234        final int b = (int)(reverseGamma(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z) * 255.999f);
235        return r << 24 | g << 16 | b << 8 | (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
236    }
237
238    /**
239     * Converts a packed float color in the format produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
240     * to a packed float in ABGR8888 format.
241     * This format of float can be used with the standard SpriteBatch and in some other places in libGDX.
242     * @param packed a packed float color, as produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
243     * @return a packed float color as ABGR8888
244     */
245    public static float toRGBA(final float packed)
246    {
247        final int decoded = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
248        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
249        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
250        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
251
252        // HSLuv to Lch
253        float C;
254        if (L > 0.99999f) {
255            L = 1;
256            C = 0;
257        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
258            L = 0;
259            C = 0;
260        } else
261            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
262
263        // Lch to Luv
264        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
265        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
266
267        // Luv to XYZ
268        float x, y, z;
269        if (L < 0.00001f) {
270            return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(decoded & 0xfe000000);
271        } else if(L > 0.9999f) {
272            return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(0xFFFFFF | (decoded & 0xfe000000));
273        }else {
274            if (L <= 0.08f)
275                y = L / kappa;
276            else {
277                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
278                y *= y * y;
279            }
280            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
281            float varU = U * iL + refU;
282            float varV = V * iL + refV;
283            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
284            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
285        }
286        final int r = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
287        final int g = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
288        final int b = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
289        return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(r | g << 8 | b << 16 | (decoded & 0xfe000000));
290    }
291
292    /**
293     * Writes a HSLuv-format packed float color (the format produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)})
294     * into an RGBA8888 Color as used by libGDX (called {@code editing}).
295     * @param editing a libGDX color that will be filled in-place with an RGBA conversion of {@code packed}
296     * @param packed a packed float color, as produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
297     * @return an RGBA8888 int color
298     */
299    public static Color toColor(Color editing, final float packed)
300    {
301        final int decoded = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
302        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
303        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
304        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
305
306        // HSLuv to Lch
307        float C;
308        if (L > 0.99999f) {
309            L = 1;
310            C = 0;
311        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
312            L = 0;
313            C = 0;
314        } else
315            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
316
317        // Lch to Luv
318        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
319        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
320
321        // Luv to XYZ
322        float x, y, z;
323        if (L < 0.00001f) {
324            editing.r = editing.g = editing.b = 0f;
325            editing.a = (decoded >>> 25) / 127f;
326            return editing;
327        } else if(L > 0.9999f) {
328            editing.r = editing.g = editing.b = 1f;
329            editing.a = (decoded >>> 25) / 127f;
330            return editing;
331        }else {
332            if (L <= 0.08f)
333                y = L / kappa;
334            else {
335                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
336                y *= y * y;
337            }
338            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
339            float varU = U * iL + refU;
340            float varV = V * iL + refV;
341            x = 2.25f * varU * y / varV;
342            z = (3f / varV - 5f) * y - x / 3f;
343        }
344        editing.r = reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f));
345        editing.g = reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z, 0f), 1f));
346        editing.b = reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z, 0f), 1f));
347        editing.a = (decoded >>> 25) / 127f;
348        return editing;
349    }
350
351    /**
352     * Writes a HSLuv-format packed float color (the format produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)})
353     * into a HSLuv-format Color called {@code editing}. This is mostly useful if the rest of your application expects
354     * colors in HSLuv format, such as because you use {@code Shaders#fragmentShaderHsluv} or {@code ColorfulBatch}.
355     * <br>
356     * Internally, this simply calls {@link Color#abgr8888ToColor(Color, float)} and returns the edited Color.
357     * @param editing a libGDX Color that will be filled in-place with the color {@code hsluv}, unchanged from its color space
358     * @param hsluv a packed float color, as produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
359     * @return an RGBA8888 int color
360     */
361    public static Color toHsluvColor(Color editing, final float hsluv){
362        Color.abgr8888ToColor(editing, hsluv);
363        return editing;
364    }
365
366    /**
367     * Takes a color encoded as an RGBA8888 int and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
368     * @param rgba an int with the channels (in order) red, green, blue, alpha; should have 8 bits per channel
369     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
370     */
371    public static float fromRGBA8888(final int rgba) {
372        final float r = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 24) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
373        final float g = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 16 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
374        final float b = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 8 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
375
376        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
377        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
378        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
379
380        // XYZ to Luv
381        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
382        if (L < 0.00001f) {
383            L = 0;
384            U = 0;
385            V = 0;
386        } else {
387            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
388            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
389        }
390
391        // Luv to Lch
392        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
393        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
394
395        // Lch to HSLuv
396        if (L > 0.99999f) {
397            s = 0;
398            l = 1;
399        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
400            s = 0;
401            l = 0;
402        } else {
403            l = forwardLight(L);
404            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
405        }
406        return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(
407                          Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
408                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
409                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
410                        | (rgba & 0xFE) << 24);
411    }
412
413    /**
414     * Takes a color encoded as an ABGR packed float and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
415     * @param packed a packed float in ABGR8888 format, with A in the MSB and R in the LSB
416     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
417     */
418    public static float fromRGBA(final float packed) {
419        final int abgr = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
420        final float r = forwardGamma((abgr & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
421        final float g = forwardGamma((abgr >>> 8 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
422        final float b = forwardGamma((abgr >>> 16 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
423
424        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
425        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
426        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
427
428        // XYZ to Luv
429        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
430//        float L = 1.16f * y - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
431        if (L < 0.00001f) {
432            L = 0;
433            U = 0;
434            V = 0;
435        } else {
436            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
437            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
438        }
439
440        // Luv to Lch
441        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
442        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
443
444        // Lch to HSLuv
445        if (L > 0.99999f) {
446            s = 0;
447            l = 1;
448        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
449            s = 0;
450            l = 0;
451        } else {
452            l = forwardLight(L);
453            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
454        }
455        return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(
456                Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
457                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
458                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
459                        | (abgr & 0xFE000000));
460    }
461
462    /**
463     * Takes a libGDX Color that uses RGBA8888 channels and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
464     * @param color a libGDX RGBA8888 Color
465     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
466     */
467    public static float fromColor(final Color color) {
468        final float r = forwardGamma(color.r);
469        final float g = forwardGamma(color.g);
470        final float b = forwardGamma(color.b);
471
472        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
473        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
474        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
475
476        // XYZ to Luv
477        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
478        if (L < 0.00001f) {
479            L = 0;
480            U = 0;
481            V = 0;
482        } else {
483            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
484            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
485        }
486
487        // Luv to Lch
488        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
489
490        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
491
492        // Lch to HSLuv
493        if (L > 0.99999f) {
494            s = 0;
495            l = 1;
496        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
497            s = 0;
498            l = 0;
499        } else {
500            l = forwardLight(L);
501            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
502        }
503        return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(
504                Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
505                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
506                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
507                        | ((int)(color.a * 255f) << 24 & 0xFE000000));
508    }
509
510    /**
511     * Takes RGBA components from 0.0 to 1.0 each and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
512     * @param r red, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
513     * @param g green, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
514     * @param b blue, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
515     * @param a alpha, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
516     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
517     */
518    public static float fromRGBA(float r, float g, float b, final float a) {
519        r = forwardGamma(r);
520        g = forwardGamma(g);
521        b = forwardGamma(b);
522
523        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
524        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
525        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
526
527        // XYZ to Luv
528        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
529        if (L < 0.00001f) {
530            L = 0;
531            U = 0;
532            V = 0;
533        } else {
534            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
535            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
536        }
537
538        // Luv to Lch
539        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
540        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
541
542
543        // Lch to HSLuv
544        if (L > 0.99999f) {
545            s = 0;
546            l = 1;
547        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
548            s = 0;
549            l = 0;
550        } else {
551            l = forwardLight(L);
552            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
553        }
554        return NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(
555                Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
556                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
557                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
558                        | ((int)(a * 255f) << 24 & 0xFE000000));
559    }
560
561        /**
562         * Gets the red channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
563         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
564         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the red channel value of the given encoded color
565         */
566        public static int redInt(final float encoded)
567        {
568        final int decoded = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
569        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
570        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
571        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
572
573        // HSLuv to Lch
574        float C;
575        if (L > 0.99999f) {
576            L = 1;
577            C = 0;
578        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
579            L = 0;
580            C = 0;
581        } else
582            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
583
584        // Lch to Luv
585        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
586        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
587
588        // Luv to XYZ
589        float x, y, z;
590        if (L < 0.00001f) {
591            x = 0;
592            y = 0;
593            z = 0;
594        } else {
595            if (L <= 0.08f)
596                y = L / kappa;
597            else {
598                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
599                y *= y * y;
600            }
601            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
602            float varU = U * iL + refU;
603            float varV = V * iL + refV;
604            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
605            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
606        }
607        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
608        }
609
610        /**
611         * Gets the green channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
612         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
613         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the green channel value of the given encoded color
614         */
615        public static int greenInt(final float encoded)
616        {
617        final int decoded = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
618        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
619        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
620        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
621
622        // HSLuv to Lch
623        float C;
624        if (L > 0.99999f) {
625            L = 1;
626            C = 0;
627        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
628            L = 0;
629            C = 0;
630        } else
631            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
632
633        // Lch to Luv
634        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
635        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
636
637        // Luv to XYZ
638        float x, y, z;
639        if (L < 0.00001f) {
640            x = 0;
641            y = 0;
642            z = 0;
643        } else {
644            if (L <= 0.08f)
645                y = L / kappa;
646            else {
647                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
648                y *= y * y;
649            }
650            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
651            float varU = U * iL + refU;
652            float varV = V * iL + refV;
653            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
654            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
655        }
656        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
657        }
658
659        /**
660         * Gets the blue channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
661         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
662         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the blue channel value of the given encoded color
663         */
664        public static int blueInt(final float encoded)
665        {
666        final int decoded = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
667        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
668        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
669        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
670
671        // HSLuv to Lch
672        float C;
673        if (L > 0.99999f) {
674            L = 1;
675            C = 0;
676        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
677            L = 0;
678            C = 0;
679        } else
680            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
681
682        // Lch to Luv
683        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
684        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
685
686        // Luv to XYZ
687        float x, y, z;
688        if (L < 0.00001f) {
689            x = 0;
690            y = 0;
691            z = 0;
692        } else {

694                y = L / kappa;
695            else {
696                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
697                y *= y * y;
698            }
699            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
700            float varU = U * iL + refU;
701            float varV = V * iL + refV;
702            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
703            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
704        }
705        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
706        }
707
708        /**
709         * Gets the alpha channel value of the given encoded color, as an even int ranging from 0 to 254, inclusive. Because
710         * of how alpha is stored in libGDX, no odd-number values are possible for alpha.
711         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
712         * @return an even int from 0 to 254, inclusive, representing the alpha channel value of the given encoded color
713         */
714        public static int alphaInt(final float encoded)
715        {
716                return (NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(encoded) & 0xfe000000) >>> 24;
717        }
718    /**
719     * Gets the red channel value of the given encoded color, as a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive.
720     * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
721     * @return a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive, representing the red channel value of the given encoded color
722     */
723    public static float red(final float encoded)
724    {
725        final int decoded = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
726        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
727        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
728        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
729
730        // HSLuv to Lch
731        float C;
732        if (L > 0.99999f) {
733            L = 1;
734            C = 0;
735        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
736            L = 0;
737            C = 0;
738        } else
739            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
740
741        // Lch to Luv
742        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
743        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
744
745        // Luv to XYZ
746        float x, y, z;
747        if (L < 0.00001f) {
748            x = 0;
749            y = 0;
750            z = 0;
751        } else {
752            if (L <= 0.08f)
753                y = L / kappa;
754            else {
755                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
756                y *= y * y;
757            }
758            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
759            float varU = U * iL + refU;
760            float varV = V * iL + refV;
761            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
762            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
763        }
764        return reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f));
765    }
